bibl.title: Letter from J.F. Siler to Philip Showalter Hench, August 8, 1950

div1.p: Siler informs Hench that the plaque commemorating the room where Walter Reed died has been placed at Fort McNair. He discusses the subsidy paid to Blossom Reed by the Walter Reed Memorial Association.

div1.head: Letter from J.F. Siler to Philip Showalter Hench, August 8, 1950
div1.opener:
GORGAS MEMORIAL INSTITUTE
OF
TROPICAL AND PREVENTIVE MEDICINE
INCORPORATED
-----
GORGAS MEMORIAL LABORATORY
JOSEPH F. SILER
PRESIDENT
MAURICE H. THATCHER
VICE PRESIDENT AND GENERAL COUNSEL
WALTER A. BLOEDORN
SECRETARY
EXECUTIVE OFFICES
1835 EYE STREET, NORTHWEST
WASHINGTON 6, D. C.
August 8, 1950
Dr. Philip S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
My dear Doctor Hench:
div1.p:
Many thanks for your note of July 28th. I thought that I
had written you some time ago concerning the erection of the memorial
plaque at Fort Lesley McNair.

We finally arranged for its erection soon after you saw it and
General Reed, General Love and I went down to see it the morning that
Major Simpson completed the job. I had intended having photographs made
prior to this time with the idea of having prints made for each member
of the board. I was down there recently, however, and it seemed desir-
able that the steps leading up to the building be filled in on each side
and planted with grass. Major Simpson promised to do that and I decided
to hold in abeyance the taking of the photograph until the grass grew up
a bit. It is my intention to go down again soon and see how it looks now
and if everything is proper I shall have a photograph made and will send
you a copy of it in the near future.

We were sorry you could not be here for the funeral of Mrs. Reed
but know that your life is an exceddingly busy one. We sent a wreath of
flowers on behalf of the Memorial Association and I thought it very beautiful.

I had the pleasure of seeing General Kean a few days ago and he
seemed to be in excellent shape for one of his age. We went around and wished
him a happy birthday. He showed me the copy of your letter to Mrs. Griswold.
I am in somewhat of a quandry as to any advice concerning the matter. If you
find it not desirable to use the money in Cuba, I think it would be very
well to add it to the capital assets of the Walter Reed Memorial Assn.

GORGAS MEMORIAL INSTITUTE
OF
TROPICAL AND PREVENTIVE MEDICINE
INCORPORATED
-----
GORGAS MEMORIAL LABORATORY

JOSEPH F. SILER
PRESIDENT
MAURICE H. THATCHER
VICE PRESIDENT AND GENERAL COUNSEL
WALTER A. BLOEDORN
SECRETARY

EXECUTIVE OFFICES
1835 EYE STREET, NORTHWEST
WASHINGTON 6, D. C.

It has been the custom of the American Security and Trust
Company to pay Mrs. Reed about the 23rd of each month. As you know, she
died on July 23rd. After consulting General Kean, we gave the bank in-
structions to forward the extra $50.00 to Blossom Reed at the same time
they forwarded the regular monthly allowance of $84 in July. This will,
of course, be the final payment of the extra $50 that has been going to
Mrs. Reed monthly for the past year and a half. I saw Blossom and she told
me that she would appreciate it very much if the extra allowance could be
paid for the month of July as it would enable her to settle up a number
of small accounts incident to her mother's last illness.

With very best regards and hoping that we shall have the pleasure
of seeing you in the fall at the annual meeting,
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, J. F. Siler
Col., (MC), U.S.A., (Ret'd) jfs k
